meanings.definition: relating to the science of the motion of air and other gases
meanings.sent1: The sleek car was so aerodynamic that it cut through the wind effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The engineer studied aerodynamic principles to understand how air flows around objects.
meanings.sent3: The balloon animal, though not aerodynamic, floated whimsically in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as swift and aerodynamic as a speeding bullet.
meanings.sent5: The bird's wings were perfectly aerodynamic, allowing it to soar gracefully through the sky.

meanings.definition: designed to reduce air resistance or drag
meanings.sent1: The cyclist wore an aerodynamic helmet to cut through the wind during the race.
meanings.sent2: The new sports car had an aerodynamic shape that made it more fuel-efficient.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to make itself more aerodynamic by tucking its flippers close to its body.
meanings.sent4: The spaceship was built with an aerodynamic design to minimize friction during re-entry.
meanings.sent5: The swimmer's streamlined body was incredibly aerodynamic, helping her glide through the water effortlessly.
